item.title: 日本执政联盟同意提高国防所得税
item.description: Japan’s Prime Minister Sanae Takaichi and her ruling coalition are poised to sign off on an income tax hike starting in 2027 to help finance a planned increase in defense spending, moving forward long-delayed plans as security concerns intensify.

item.title: 澳新银行因不当行为被法院罚款 1.65 亿美元
item.description: 澳大利亚联邦法院将澳新银行集团控股有限公司的罚金提高到 2.5 亿澳元（1.65 亿美元），因为在此前的监管处罚基础上又追加了 1,000 万澳元。【原文：ANZ Group Holdings Ltd.’s fine was increased to A$250 million ($165 million) by the Federal Court of Australia after an additional A$10 million was added to earlier regulatory penalties.】

item.title: 选股者在澳大利亚养老金大会上因指数风险而重获青睐
item.description: 澳大利亚第二大养老基金澳大利亚退休信托基金（Australian Retirement Trust）正在将更多资金从被动型指数基金转向主动型股票经理。澳大利亚第二大养老基金澳大利亚退休信托基金（Australian Retirement Trust）正在将更多资金从被动型指数基金转向主动型股票经理，理由是大型科技公司在全球基准中的主导地位日益增强。【原文：Australian Retirement Trust, the nation’s no. 2 pension fund, is switching more money from passive index funds to active equity managers, citing the growing dominance of major technology companies in global benchmarks.】

item.title: 新西兰消费者和企业乐观情绪刺激经济增长
item.description: 12 月份，新西兰商业信心飙升至三十年来的最高点，消费者的情绪也大幅高涨，这为第四季度乃至 2026 年的经济进一步扩张增添了迹象。【原文：New Zealand business confidence soared to a three-decade high in December and the mood of consumers also surged, adding to signs of further economic expansion in the fourth quarter and into 2026.】

item.title: GfK 称，英国购物者信心回升，准备大举消费
item.description: 一项著名的调查显示，与蕾切尔-里夫斯（Rachel Reeves）提出预算案之前相比，英国人更倾向于购买大件商品。【原文：Britons are more likely to buy big-ticket items than they were before Rachel Reeves’ budget, according to a prominent survey that suggests sentiment has improved in the run up to Christmas.】

item.title: 中央银行预测：外国投资将促进爱尔兰经济增长
item.description: 爱尔兰中央银行上调了国内经济增长预期，原因是跨国投资前景更加强劲。【原文：The Central Bank of Ireland revised up its domestic growth forecast due to a stronger outlook for multinational investment.】

item.title: 日本通胀率在日本央行预期加息前稳定在 3
item.description: 日本的关键通胀指标连续第二个月保持在 3%的水平，这表明在普遍预期日本央行将把借贷成本提高到三十年来最高水平之前的几个小时，物价压力仍在持续。【原文：Japan’s key inflation gauge stayed at 3% for a second month, signaling sustained price pressure hours before the Bank of Japan is widely expected to boost borrowing costs to the highest level in three decades.】

item.title: Oil Heads for Second Weekly Decline as Glut Concerns Dominate
item.description: 由于对供应过剩的担忧超过了对潜在供应中断的担忧，石油连续第二周下跌。【原文：Oil headed for a second weekly decline as concerns over a growing glut outweighed potential supply disruptions.】

item.title: 信用风险增加，澳大利亚富人涌入私人市场
item.description: 越来越多的澳大利亚富人将资金转向私人市场，这重塑了澳大利亚最富有的人积累财富的方式。但这种转变是在全球信贷风险激增的情况下发生的。【原文：Wealthy Australians are increasingly steering their money into private markets, reshaping the way the nation’s richest build their fortunes. But the shift is unfolding as global credit risks stir.】

item.title: 要约收购威胁挤压 Topix 500 跌幅最大的股票

But analysts warn that this strategy may end in a short squeeze if the drug store operator’s earnings beat expectations.】

item.title: 前网络安全人员因兼职黑客而认罪
item.description: 周四，两名网络安全公司的前雇员承认犯有联邦罪行，他们发动了自己的勒索软件攻击，阴谋向美国各地的受害者勒索数百万美元。【原文：Two former employees of cybersecurity companies pleaded guilty on Thursday to federal crimes for launching their own ransomware attacks in a plot to extort millions of dollars from victims around the US.】

item.title: 美国消费物价指数提振股市和债券，亚洲股市将上涨：市场综述
item.description: 在降温的通胀数据凸显了美联储减息的理由，以及科技股的平息支撑了美国股市之后，亚洲股市将继续攀升。【原文：Asian equities were set to climb after cooling inflation data underscored the case for Federal Reserve cuts and calming tech jitters supported US stocks.】

item.title: Francisco Partners 据称酝酿以 10 亿美元出售 MyHeritage

item.description: 由于中国抛售了部分库存，10 月份美国国债的海外持有量有所下降，而日本和英国等国家的持有量则有所增加。【原文：Overseas holdings of US Treasuries dipped in October as China sold down some of its stockpile while countries including Japan and the UK saw increases on the month.】

item.title: 科技界亿万富翁为欧洲核子研究中心的下一次物理突破提供 10 亿美元支持
item.description: 包括埃里克-施密特（Eric Schmidt）和法国泽维尔-尼尔（Xavier Niel）在内的一些科技界富豪已向欧洲核子研究中心（CERN）认捐了多达 8.6 亿欧元（10 亿美元）的资金，用于资助拟议中的大型强子对撞机的后续项目。【原文：Some of the wealthiest individuals in technology including Eric Schmidt and France’s Xavier Niel have pledged as much as €860 million ($1 billion) to CERN to fund a proposed successor to the Large Hadron Collider, as the storied research institute turns to private backers for the first time to back future breakthroughs.】

item.title: AI Demand Strains Japan Cable Firm Fujikura After Stock Surge
item.description: 由于全球新建的数据中心对藤仓有限公司的电缆需求旺盛，该公司的股价在过去两年中飙升了约 1400%。问题只有一个：公司无法满足需求。【原文：Fujikura Ltd.’s stock has surged about 1,400% over the last two years as new data centers globally have created an insatiable appetite for its cables. There’s only one problem — the company can’t keep up with demand.】
